intro: Elsholtzia cristata f. minima, commonly known as the dwarf crested germander, is a compact, mat-forming perennial herb native to arid regions of China. It features small, aromatic leaves that are densely packed and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers in spikes during the summer months, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a desirable plant for arid landscape designs.
